We're ranked #33 in the 2019 Inc. 500 list within the software category. Come join our team!
Epion is hiring a new Product Manager! Interested? Check it out:

The healthcare industry seems to have new rules and regulations on a regular basis. One of these is the Merit-based Incentive Payment System (MIPS). In order to help athenahealth users adjust, we're offering a complimentary webinar on 7/24 and 7/26. Join us for highlights from the new 2019 proposed rule on #MIPS from #CMS. Learn to run your MIPS reports in Athena and receive practical tips on how to maximize reimbursements and value-based program bonuses. https://bit.ly/2LnqKqE
Office-based technologies, like tablets in the waiting room, allow practices to efficiently capture Patient-Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs) and assess quality of care.

What is #digitalcheckin? Epion streamlines check-in and intake by having patients enter their own registration, demographic, and health history information on tablets while in your waiting room. Our discrete data integration with athenahealth means patient-entered information updates the #EMR in real-time. Learn more at https://lnkd.in/d4GhTEs

A big thank you to our partners at athenahealth for featuring our own - Joe Blewitt in yesterday's "Fireside Chat" at #HIMSS18! Great insights and unique perspectives from three industry CEOs on some of the ways #HIT is helping reduce friction in healthcare.

Our CEO, Joe Blewitt discusses how Epion's partnership with athenahealth has enabled healthcare organizations to significantly improve patient data collection and streamline administrative and clinical workflows, live in #HIMSS18 booth #119 on Tuesday 3/6 from 4:30-5:15PM. https://lnkd.in/gq8XRYr
Patients are more likely to answer screening questionnaires, like the #PHQ9, more honestly when given the opportunity to self-report privately #HIT

Mark your calendars! Don’t miss Joe Blewitt, Epion CEO, at athenahealth's “Fireside Chat” at #HIMSS18 – 4:30pm Tues 3/6 – Booth #119. Joe and other #MDP partners will share how their work focuses on “reducing the friction” in healthcare by removing clicks and putting patients first. #HIT
